document_data.name: Vaasan
document_data.mainbody: '''Vaasans''', also called '''Tesharans''', '''Tharrans''', or '''Yûls''', were one of the lesser-known ethnic groups of [[human]]ity. The term referred to the peoples of [[Vaasa]] as well as parts of the [[Moonsea]] and the [[Dalelands]].
document_data.Description: Vaasan people typically had skin tones ranging from fair to olive with dark hair. and they grew thick beards.
document_data.Culture:
Vaasans generally used the [[Damaran language]],{{Cite dragon/Speaking in Tongues|26}}

They were open to worshiping any [[gods]] of the [[Faerûnian pantheon]], however they had a reputation for favoring darker gods such as [[Auril]], [[Bane]], [[Cyric]],
document_data.History:
Vaasan heritage traces back to [[Netherese]] ancestry. After the fall of [[Netheril]]'s survivor states of [[Asram]], [[Anauria]], and [[Hlondath]], Netherese refugees traveled east to the Moonsea to found new realms, beginning with [[Teshar]] in the {{YearlinkName|-87}}, followed by [[Yûlash]] and [[Northkeep]]. These people would be joined over the following centuries by the second group that would come to be known as the forebears of Vaasan culture, [[Chondathan]]s from the Dalelands, [[Sembia]], and [[the Vast]]. The two peoples would go on to found the Moonsea city-states of [[Hulburg]], [[Melvaunt]], [[Mulmaster]], [[Phlan]], [[Thentia]], and [[Zhentil Keep]].

By the late 15th Century DR, Vaasa had seen an influx of [[Damaran]] immigrants from [[Damara]], [[Impiltur]], and [[Narfell]] who had integrated into Vaasan society.{{Cite dungeon/177/Realmslore: Vaasa|77}}
